text.content:
Traps follow a set of special rules.

  • Except for the Master Trapper Heroic skill, traps can only be deployed outside of battles and beyond the perception of the target creatures.

  • To set a trap, you perform the Inventory action and spend a number of Inventory Points equal to the 【SL】 required to learn the trap.

  • Upon setting a trap, you may spend 10 Mind Points to choose one option: the trap gains multi (2) — or you increase the trap’s multi property by one, up to a maximum of multi (3).

  • If the trap is not in the predicted route of any foe, you may try luring creatures toward it. Prepare the terrain as best as you can!

  • Upon touching the trap, a creature rolls an Opposed 【DEX + INS】 Check against you. You gain a bonus equal to 【SL】 on this check. If your trap has the multi property, only one check is required. You or the Game Master decide which additional creatures are affected.

  • If the creature that touched the trap passes the opposed check, the trap fails, and you lose the IP spent. The enemy might be now aware of your presence.

  • At any point during the scene, if the trap remains untouched and there are no foes observing you, you may safely disable it and recover your IP.

  • If, for any reason, you leave the scene before retrieving an untouched trap, the Game Master may decide, depending on the circumstances of your departure, whether you have retrieved the trap.
